# MLDataValueConvertible

**Protocol**

A type that can convert itself to and from a data value.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol MLDataValueConvertible
```

## Overview

You can use any type that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataValueConvertible] protocol in an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataValue] or an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable]. For example, you can create a data table by using its [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/init(dictionary:)] initializer with a `[`[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/String]`: ``MLDataValueConvertible``]` dictionary.

## Converting from a data value to a type’s instance

- **init()**: Creates a new default instance of the conforming type when a data value is missing or invalid.
- **init(from:)**: Creates an instance of the conforming type from a data value.

## Converting from a type’s instance to a data value

- **dataValue**: The value of the conforming type’s instance wrapped in a data value.
- **dataValueType**: The underlying type the conforming type uses when it wraps itself in a data value.

## Conforming Types

- MLDataValue.DictionaryType
- MLDataValue.MultiArrayType
- MLDataValue.SequenceType
